title: Audit predicate function naming conventions
description:
Ensure all boolean-returning functions follow Elixir naming conventions.

Check that all predicates:
- End with '?' (e.g., valid?, has_conditionals?)
- Are not used as guards (guards should use 'is_' prefix)

Tasks:
1. Grep for all boolean-returning functions
2. Verify naming follows conventions
3. Update any non-conforming functions
4. Add to style guide documentation

Benefits: Consistent API, follows Elixir conventions, better readability.
Estimated effort: 1 hour.
See ARCHITECTURE_ASSESSMENT for details.

title: Fix Nx backend configuration anti-pattern
description:
Library currently uses compile-time config for Nx backend, violating library best practices. 

Problem: Users cannot override backend choice easily.

Solution: Add runtime backend selection via options:
- Add :backend option to run/2 and other functions
- Allow users to control backend per-operation
- Maintain backward compatibility

Benefits: Better library user experience, testability, follows Elixir conventions.
Estimated effort: 2-4 hours.
See ARCHITECTURE_ASSESSMENT for details.

title: Audit and document error handling patterns
description:
Current error handling is inconsistent across modules:
- Most functions raise exceptions
- Some use tuple returns
- Need clear philosophy documented

Tasks:
1. Document error-handling philosophy in CONTRIBUTING.md
2. Audit all public functions for consistency
3. Consider adding safe_* variants that return {:ok, result} | {:error, reason}
4. Update documentation to clarify which functions raise

Benefits: Consistent API, better user experience, clearer expectations.
Estimated effort: 2-3 hours.
See ARCHITECTURE_ASSESSMENT for details.

title: Create Qx.Export.OpenQASM module structure
description: Create the base module lib/qx/export/openqasm.ex with module structure, documentation, and main to_qasm/2 function signature. Follow Elixir conventions with {:ok, qasm} | {:error, reason} return type.

title: Implement basic gate mapping
description: Map Qx gates to OpenQASM statements: H, X, Y, Z, S, T, CNOT (cx), CZ, Toffoli (ccx). Create helper functions for each gate type. Handle single-qubit and multi-qubit gates.

title: Implement parameterized rotation gates
description: Add support for RX, RY, RZ, and Phase gates with angle parameters. Ensure proper parameter formatting (radians) in OpenQASM output.

title: Add measurement and classical bit support
description: Implement measurement operations mapping to OpenQASM 'measure' statements. Handle classical bit declarations and assignments. Support both single qubit and register measurements.

title: Implement conditional operations support
description: Map Qx c_if conditional operations to OpenQASM 3.0 'if' statements. Handle classical bit conditions and nested gate applications within conditionals.

title: Generate OpenQASM header and declarations
description: Generate proper OpenQASM 3.0 file header (OPENQASM 3.0;), include stdgates.inc, declare qubits and classical bits. Support version option for OpenQASM 2.0 vs 3.0.

title: Add barrier support
description: Map Qx barrier instructions to OpenQASM barrier statements for circuit visualization organization.

title: Write comprehensive tests for OpenQASM exporter
description: Create test/qx/export/openqasm_test.exs with tests for: basic gates, rotations, measurements, conditionals, complex circuits (Bell state, GHZ, quantum teleportation). Validate generated QASM syntax.

title: Add documentation and examples
description: Add @moduledoc and @doc for all public functions. Create examples/ directory with sample QASM exports. Update main Qx module documentation to mention OpenQASM export capability.

title: Add @moduledoc to all modules
description:
Some internal modules are missing @moduledoc documentation:
- Qx.Calc
- Qx.CalcFast
- Qx.StateInit (verify)
- Qx.Format (verify)

All modules (even internal) should have @moduledoc explaining:
- Module purpose
- Performance characteristics (for CalcFast)
- Whether it's internal or public API

Benefits: Better code navigation, clearer purpose, complete ExDoc.
Estimated effort: 2-3 hours.
See ARCHITECTURE_ASSESSMENT for details.

title: Refactor Draw module - split into focused sub-modules
description:
The Qx.Draw module is 1,531 lines, violating single responsibility principle. Split into:
- Qx.Draw.VegaLite (VegaLite charts)
- Qx.Draw.SVG.Circuit (SVG circuit diagrams)
- Qx.Draw.SVG.Bloch (Bloch sphere rendering)
- Qx.Draw.Tables (state/probability tables)
- Qx.Draw (facade/router)

Benefits: Better maintainability, easier testing, clearer responsibilities.
Estimated effort: 4-8 hours.
See ARCHITECTURE_ASSESSMENT for details.

title: Add test coverage metrics to CI/CD
description:
Currently no test coverage reporting in CI/CD pipeline.

Add ExCoveralls integration:
- Add to mix.exs dependencies
- Configure coverage reporting
- Set coverage targets (>80%)
- Add to GitHub Actions workflow
- Generate HTML reports

Benefits: Measure test quality, identify untested code, prevent regressions.
Estimated effort: 1-2 hours.
See ARCHITECTURE_ASSESSMENT for details.
